intro: Duroia palustris, commonly known as swamp durio, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and ability to thrive in wetland environments. The plant typically grows in dense thickets and is often found in areas with high humidity and poor soil conditions. Its leaves are usually large, broad, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Duroia palustris plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
